intro: Echites tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. Echites tenuifolius is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
